segments.text: Body language in the interview is closely related to the job-hunter's image .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You should look the interviewer in the eye so as to show that you are carefully listening to him .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You can nod or ask questions at the right time to show that you have already understood or you are quite interested in his words .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When you are seated , bent forward a little with your hands crossed , to show you respect the interviewer .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don't move from time to time . It is very impolite and will make you nervous .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Proper posture can show your confidence .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The best would be you have a smile on your face in the interview to win a good impression of the interviewer .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Pay attention to keeping eye contact as well .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Throughout the interview you should maintain patience .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: In a word , you should keep decent manners in the interview .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Only in this way can you leave the interviewer a good impression and achieve success .
segments.speaker: S2
